parametrized_description: A metal-working shop has access to two types of metal-working equipment, a ChopSaw and a SteelCutter. A ChopSaw can cut ChopSawCuttingCapacity pounds of steel and generates ChopSawWaste units of waste per day. A SteelCutter can cut SteelCutterCuttingCapacity pounds of steel and generates SteelCutterWaste units of waste per day. The metal-working shop must cut TotalCuttingRequirement pounds of metal every day. The waste generated must not exceed WasteLimit units per day. How should the metal-working shop purchase their metal-working equipment to minimize the total number of metal-working equipment needed?

ChopSawCuttingCapacity.description: Cutting capacity of a chop saw in pounds per day

ChopSawWaste.description: Waste generated by a chop saw per day

SteelCutterCuttingCapacity.description: Cutting capacity of a steel cutter in pounds per day

SteelCutterWaste.description: Waste generated by a steel cutter per day

TotalCuttingRequirement.description: Total metal cutting requirement per day in pounds

WasteLimit.description: Maximum allowable waste per day in units

NumberOfChopSaws.description: The number of chop saws used

NumberOfSteelCutters.description: The number of steel cutters used

constraints.description: The total metal cutting capacity of ChopSaws and SteelCutters must be at least 520 pounds per day.
The total waste generated by ChopSaws and SteelCutters must not exceed 400 units per day.

objective.description: Minimize the total number of metal-working equipment (ChopSaws and SteelCutters) needed to meet the daily cutting and waste requirements.
